recipes.name: Chicken and Vegetable Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan).
Season chicken with salt, pepper, and thyme.
Heat oil in a large casserole dish, brown chicken pieces on all sides. Remove and set aside.
Add onions, carrots, and celery to the dish. Cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Sprinkle flour over vegetables, stir well.
Add potatoes and stock, bring to a simmer.
Return chicken to the dish, cover with lid.
Bake for 75 minutes until chicken is tender and sauce has thickened.
Let cool slightly before serving or freezing portions.
recipes.avaFriendly: Perfect for Ava! Mild flavors and soft textures. Cut chicken into small pieces for her.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of white wine when making the sauce for extra depth.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes brilliantly for up to 3 months. Perfect for batch cooking.

recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mince and cook until browned, breaking up with a spoon.
Add onion, garlic, and carrots. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato purée and cook for 1 minute.
Add tinned tomatoes, stock, and oregano. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Serve bolognese over spaghetti with grated cheese.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava loves this! The grated carrots add hidden veg. Cut the spaghetti into shorter pieces for easier eating.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of red wine with the tomatoes for a richer sauce.
recipes.storageNotes: Freeze the sauce (without pasta) in portions for up to 3 months.

recipes.name: Homemade Fish Fingers with Chips
ingredients: 400g white fish fillets (cod or haddock, Aldi)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan).
Toss potato chips with 1 tbsp oil and spread on a baking tray. Bake for 30 minutes.
Cut fish into finger-sized pieces.
Set up three bowls: flour in one, beaten eggs in another, breadcrumbs in the third.
Coat each fish piece in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
Place on a lined baking tray, drizzle with remaining oil.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Serve with chips and peas.
recipes.avaFriendly: Total winner with Ava! Much healthier than shop-bought versions.
recipes.adultsVariation: Serve with tartar sauce and malt vinegar.
recipes.storageNotes: Fish fingers can be frozen uncooked. Cook from frozen, adding 5 minutes to cooking time.

recipes.name: Quick Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a large wok or frying pan over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until cooked through.
Add garlic and vegetables, stir-fry for 4-5 minutes.
Mix soy sauce and honey, pour over the stir-fry.
Toss everything together for 2 minutes.
Serve over rice.
recipes.avaFriendly: Great for Ava! Mild and slightly sweet. Cut chicken into tiny pieces.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili flakes or sriracha for a kick.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh, but leftovers keep for 2 days in the fridge.

recipes.name: Family Beef Chili
ingredients: 1 tbsp mild chili powder (reduce for Ava)
Rice or jacket potatoes to serve
instructions: Brown the mince in a large pot, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add onions and garlic, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, and tomato purée. Cook for 1 minute.
Add tinned tomatoes and stock. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 40 minutes.
Add kidney beans, simmer for 10 more minutes.
Serve with rice or jacket potatoes.
recipes.avaFriendly: Keep Ava's portion mild - use less chili powder in her serving. She likes it with rice.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add extra chili, jalapeños, or hot sauce to adult portions.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes perfectly for up to 3 months.

recipes.name: Creamy Salmon Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Add peas for the last 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a pan. Season salmon and cook skin-side down for 4 minutes.
Flip and cook for 3 more minutes. Remove from pan and flake into chunks.
In the same pan, add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add crème fraîche, lemon juice, and zest. Warm through.
Drain pasta and peas, add to the sauce with salmon.
Toss gently and serve.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava enjoys this! Make sure to remove any bones and check the salmon carefully.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add capers or a splash of white wine to the sauce.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Leftovers keep for 1 day.

recipes.name: Traditional Cottage Pie
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and mash with butter and milk.
Brown mince in a large pan. Add onion and carrots, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato purée, cook for 1 minute.
Add stock and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened.
Transfer mince mixture to an ovenproof dish.
Spread mashed potato over the top, creating peaks with a fork.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 200°C (180°C fan) for 25 minutes until golden.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava loves the creamy mash topping! Make sure the meat is well-cooked and not too chunky.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of red wine to the meat mixture.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months. Can be cooked from frozen.

recipes.name: Homemade Chicken Nuggets
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan).
Mix breadcrumbs with garlic powder and paprika.
Set up three bowls: seasoned flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumb mixture.
Coat each chicken piece in flour, egg, then breadcrumbs.
Place on a lined baking tray.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, turning halfway, until golden and cooked through.
Serve with vegetables and ketchup.
recipes.avaFriendly: These are Ava's absolute favorite! So much better than shop-bought.
recipes.adultsVariation: Make a spicy version with cayenne pepper in the breadcrumbs.
recipes.storageNotes: Freeze uncooked nuggets. Cook from frozen, adding 5 minutes to cooking time.

recipes.name: Sausage and Bean Casserole
instructions: Brown sausages in a large casserole dish. Remove and set aside.
Add onion to the dish, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomato purée, chopped tomatoes, stock, and herbs.
Return sausages to the dish, add beans.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 30 minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava likes this with the sausages cut into small pieces. Very filling and comforting.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of balsamic vinegar or red wine for depth.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months.

recipes.name: Easy Fish Pie
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with 25g butter and 50ml milk.
Poach fish in 300ml milk for 8-10 minutes. Drain, reserving the milk. Flake fish into chunks.
Melt remaining butter in a pan, stir in flour to make a roux.
Gradually add the reserved milk, stirring constantly until thickened.
Add fish, prawns, peas, and parsley to the sauce. Transfer to an ovenproof dish.
Top with mashed potato, creating peaks with a fork.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 200°C (180°C fan) for 25-30 minutes until golden.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava enjoys the creamy texture. Check carefully for any fish bones before serving.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of white wine to the sauce or top with a cheese crust.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 1 month.

recipes.name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: Grated cheese, sour cream, salsa to serve
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan over high heat.
Add chicken, cook for 5-6 minutes until nearly cooked.
Add peppers and onions, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Sprinkle with fajita seasoning, toss well. Cook for 2 more minutes.
Warm tortillas according to package instructions.
Serve chicken mixture with tortillas and toppings.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava loves making her own! Use mild seasoning and let her build her own fajita (with help).
recipes.adultsVariation: Add jalapeños, hot sauce, or extra seasoning for adults.
recipes.storageNotes: Chicken mixture keeps for 2 days. Reheat thoroughly before serving.

recipes.name: Italian Meatballs in Tomato Sauce
instructions: Mix mince, half the onion, half the garlic, breadcrumbs, egg, and oregano in a bowl.
Form into 20 meatballs.
Brown meatballs in a large pan (you may need to do this in batches). Set aside.
In the same pan, cook remaining onion for 5 minutes. Add remaining garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomato purée, tinned tomatoes, and stock.
Return meatballs to the pan, bring to a simmer.
Cover and simmer for 25 minutes.
Serve with spaghetti or rice.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava thinks these are fun! Make smaller meatballs for her portions.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add red wine to the sauce or serve with parmesan.
recipes.storageNotes: Freeze meatballs in sauce for up to 3 months.

recipes.name: Classic Roast Chicken Dinner
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan).
Rub chicken with 1 tbsp oil, herbs, salt, and pepper. Place in a roasting tin.
Toss potatoes and carrots with remaining oil, season, and arrange around chicken.
Roast for 90 minutes (or until juices run clear when thigh is pierced).
Remove chicken and vegetables, rest chicken for 10 minutes.
Make gravy using pan juices and gravy granules.
Carve chicken and serve with roast vegetables and gravy.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava loves roast chicken! Give her tender breast meat cut into small pieces.
recipes.adultsVariation: Stuff the cavity with lemon and herbs for extra flavor.
recipes.storageNotes: Leftover chicken is perfect for sandwiches and meals throughout the week.

recipes.name: Pork Chops with Apples
ingredients: Mashed potatoes and green beans to serve
instructions: Season pork chops with salt, pepper, and sage.
Heat oil in a large pan, cook chops for 4-5 minutes each side until golden. Remove and set aside.
Add butter to the pan, cook onion for 3 minutes.
Add apple slices, cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in stock, bring to a simmer.
Return chops to the pan, simmer for 5 minutes until cooked through.
Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.
recipes.avaFriendly: The sweet apples make this appealing to Ava. Cut the pork into small pieces for her.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of cider or cream to the sauce.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Leftovers keep for 1 day.

recipes.name: Tuna Pasta Bake
ingredients: 2 x 160g tins tuna in spring water, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan).
Cook pasta for 2 minutes less than package instructions. Drain.
Mix pasta with tuna, tomatoes, crème fraîche, sweetcorn, and oregano.
Transfer to an ovenproof dish.
Top with grated cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbling and golden.
Serve with salad or garlic bread.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava enjoys the cheesy topping! Make sure tuna is well mixed in.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili flakes or capers for extra flavor.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months.

recipes.name: Mild Chicken Curry
ingredients: Rice and naan bread to serve
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan, cook chicken until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add onion, cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and curry powder, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes, coconut milk, and mango chutney.
Return chicken to the pan, simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with rice and naan bread.
recipes.avaFriendly: Very mild and slightly sweet - perfect for Ava! She likes it with plain rice.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add extra curry powder, fresh chilies, or garam masala for adults.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes perfectly for up to 3 months. Freeze without rice.

recipes.name: Easy Beef Tacos
ingredients: Lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream to serve
instructions: Brown mince in a pan, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add onion, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in taco seasoning and water.
Simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Warm taco shells according to package instructions.
Serve with toppings and let everyone build their own tacos.
recipes.avaFriendly: Ava loves the interactive element! Use soft tortillas for her and mild seasoning.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add jalapeños, hot sauce, or extra seasoning.
recipes.storageNotes: Meat mixture keeps for 2 days in the fridge.

recipes.name: One-Pan Chicken Traybake
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan).
Toss potatoes, peppers, and onion with 1 tbsp oil, half the paprika, and thyme in a roasting tin.
Make space in the center, place chicken thighs skin-side up.
Rub chicken with remaining oil and paprika, season with salt and pepper.
Roast for 45-50 minutes until chicken is golden and vegetables are tender.
Serve straight from the tin.
recipes.avaFriendly: Easy meal with everything cooked together. Remove chicken skin for Ava if preferred.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add chili flakes or garlic for extra flavor.
recipes.storageNotes: Leftovers keep for 2 days in the fridge.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: Couscous or new potatoes to serve
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan).
Arrange broccoli and tomatoes on a baking tray. Drizzle with 1 tbsp oil and season.
Roast for 10 minutes.
Place salmon fillets among the vegetables. Drizzle with remaining oil, lemon juice, and garlic.
Roast for 15 minutes until salmon is cooked through.
Serve with lemon zest sprinkled over and couscous or new potatoes.
recipes.avaFriendly: Healthy and colorful! Check salmon carefully for bones before serving to Ava.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add white wine, capers, or herbs to the roasting tray.
recipes.storageNotes: Best eaten fresh. Leftovers keep for 1 day.

recipes.name: Classic Shepherd's Pie
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and mash with butter and milk.
Brown lamb mince in a large pan. Add onion and carrots, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in tomato purée, cook for 1 minute.
Add stock and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened.
Transfer lamb mixture to an ovenproof dish.
Spread mashed potato over the top, creating peaks with a fork.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Bake at 200°C (180°C fan) for 25 minutes until golden.
recipes.avaFriendly: Similar to cottage pie which Ava loves. Ensure the lamb is well-cooked and tender.
recipes.adultsVariation: Add a splash of red wine or fresh rosemary to the lamb.
recipes.storageNotes: Freezes well for up to 2 months.
